events.message: Customer reported a collision involving their vehicle at an intersection, resulting in visible front-end damage.
Claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident as it involves a car collision.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the customer's auto accident claim for further processing.
Customer received confirmation that their auto accident claim has been acknowledged by the insurance company.
Request sent for police report, photos of vehicle damage, and driver’s license to proceed with claim.
Customer submitted all requested documents including police report and vehicle repair estimate.
Claims team has begun investigation into the circumstances of the vehicle collision.
Investigation concluded determining the customer was not at fault in the vehicle accident.
A settlement offer was proposed to cover vehicle repair costs based on investigation results.
Customer expressed satisfaction with the timely handling and proposed settlement of the claim.
The insurance company approved the claim, authorizing release of payment for vehicle repairs.
Payment was successfully issued to the customer’s chosen repair shop to cover car repair expenses.
The auto accident claim was officially closed following payment issuance and customer confirmation.
All claim documents and correspondence related to the vehicle accident claim were archived securely.
